abstract.p: Letter by Arnold Huberman responds to June 15 article on growing complexity of car radios; says article barely mentions practical solution to the problems the article refers to, namely controls on the steering wheel

block.p: ''For Car Radio, a Midlife Crisis'' (June 15), about the growing complexity of car radios, barely mentions a practical solution to the problems the article refers to, a solution that already exists on many cars. My Jeep comes equipped with controls on the steering wheel. If I have a CD loaded, I can control the radio or the CD player without ever taking my hands off the steering wheel. It is a low-tech solution that could very well save lives.
